profile.name: Alessandra Parziale
profile.title: Research Assistant
profile.specialty: Currently working on Fairness Engineering and Testing

paragraphs: I graduated cum laud in 2024 with a Master's degree in Computer Science from the University of Salerno, specializing in Software Engineering and IT Management.
I am currently a Research Assistant at the Software Engineering Laboratory [SeSa Lab], under the supervision of Prof. Fabio Palomba and Prof. Andrea De Lucia.

My research interests primarily focus on Software Engineering, with particular attention to the ethical and social aspects of Machine Learning-based systems. Specifically, my work explores topics as Fairness Engineering, Bias Monitoring, and Fairness Testing.

publications.title: Contextual Fairness-Aware Practices in ML: A Cost-Effective Empirical Evaluation
publications.authors: A. Parziale, G. Voria, G. Giordano, G. Catolino, G. Robles, F. Palomba
publications.journal: Proceedings of the 1st International Workshop on Fairness in Software Systems (Fairness’2025)

awards.title: Best Paper Award For Contextual Fairness-Aware Practices in ML
awards.description:

experience.title: Erasmus+ Traineeship

projects.title: Esistere
projects.description:
Managed a team of university students to develop Esistere,
a web application dedicated to creating technological solutions
to improve the lives of Alzheimer's patients and their caregivers.
